    • connect

      public NSP.HandshakeReader connect​(String address, int port, int timeout) throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException
      Initializes a connection with the Server, and automatically accepts the Handshake Process, starting the connection running.

      address - Server Address
      port - Server Port
      Returns:
      HandshakeReader
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an encryption error.
      GeneralSecurityException - If there is a socket error.

    • scan

      public HashMap<String,​NSP.HandshakeReader> scan​(int port, int start, int end, boolean obtainable) throws GeneralSecurityException, IOException
      Scans the specified range of IP addresses starting with 192.168.1.X for any Servers currently running on those addresses, and attempts to Handshake and receive information. If Obtainable is enabled, only servers that are guaranteed to work with the currently set options will be added to the list. This feature is only recommended being used on local Wi-Fi networks!
      Parameters:
      port - Port to Scan
      start - IP Address Start
      end - IP Address End
      obtainable - If the address
      Returns:
      HashMap of IP Address and HandshakeReader of successful Servers
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException
      IOException

    • scan

      public HashMap<String,​NSP.HandshakeReader> scan​(int port, boolean obtainable) throws GeneralSecurityException, IOException
      Scans the range of IP addresses from 192.168.1.2 to 192.168.1.254 for any Servers currently running on those addresses, and attempts to Handshake and receive information. If Obtainable is enabled, only servers that are guaranteed to work with the currently set options will be added to the list. This feature is only recommended being used on local Wi-Fi networks!
      Parameters:
      port - Port to Scan
      obtainable - If the address
      Returns:
      HashMap of IP Address and HandshakeReader of successful Servers
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException
      IOException
